newsitem.title: JAPAN: MOF plans harsh penalties for DKB --paper.
newsitem.headline: MOF plans harsh penalties for DKB --paper.

text.p: The Ministry of Finance (MOF) is planning to impose harsh penalties on Dai-Ichi Kangyo Bank Ltd (DKB), which may take the form of an order by the finance minister to suspend part of its operations, a Japanese business daily said on Friday.
The Nihon Keizai Shimbun said that, if DKB is ordered to halt some operations, it would be the first such order ever against a Japanese commercial bank.
Prosecutors on Thursday arrested four DKB officials on suspicion of illegally lending 11.78 billion yen to a racketeer.
MOF officials were not immediately available for comment on the report.
